results.snippet: RIDING easy from Los Angeles, on the Super-chief express, the whole country seems to reek of What They Have Done To It. You imagined the desert as a vast inconsolable palm, but here it is before you -- a series of vacant lots strewn with stripped...
results.lead_paragraph: RIDING easy from Los Angeles, on the Super-chief express, the whole country seems to reek of What They Have Done To It. You imagined the desert as a vast inconsolable palm, but here it is before you -- a series of vacant lots strewn with stripped Oldsmobiles. You remember Mark Strand's poem about the "blue-eyed government," and it's very much in evidence here.

headline.main: NASA Resignations

results.snippet: The gap between science and engineering in NASA's manned space program seems to be widening, and the scientists are coming out on the short end. The most recent evidence for this are the recent resignations of four leading scientists at the Manned...
results.lead_paragraph: The gap between science and engineering in NASA's manned space program seems to be widening, and the scientists are coming out on the short end. The most recent evidence for this are the recent resignations of four leading scientists at the Manned Spacecraft Center -chief scientist Wilmot Hess, scientist-astronaut F. Curtis Michel, and geologists Elbert King and Donald Wise.

results.lead_paragraph: A grateful nation paid abundant and emotional tribute to the Apollo 11 astronauts last week. The millions who turned out in New York, Chicago and Los Angeles to applaud and cheer the Columbuses of the moon provided more proof, if any were needed, that there is an overwhelming national consensus that these three brave men have given the country genuine cause for pride and pleasure.

headline.main: A Circus, Homemade and Full of Gaiety

results.snippet: DOBBS FERRY, N. Y. -- Acrobats. Cowboys and Indians. A menagerie. Popcorn and peanuts. Astronauts. The circus is coming to Dobbs Ferry and, if not The Greatest Show on Earth, it certainly is one of the most enthusiastic. It is the Children's...
results.lead_paragraph: DOBBS FERRY, N. Y. -- Acrobats. Cowboys and Indians. A menagerie. Popcorn and peanuts. Astronauts. The circus is coming to Dobbs Ferry and, if not The Greatest Show on Earth, it certainly is one of the most enthusiastic. It is the Children's Village's 11th annual performance, a day of gaiety that has attracted audiences of up to 2,000 from New York City and surrounding Westchester County for a Labor Day afternoon.

results.abstract: H Dolan, black writer for Julia series, discusses problems facing black writers for TV

headline.main: Can an Angry Black Man Write Of Laughter and Love ?

results.snippet: IN 1965 I wrote an article entitled "Will There Be Another Riot in Watts?" And I concluded, No, not as a spontaneous frustrated explosion resulting in indiscriminate slaughter. No, this will not happen again, for the truth of the matter is those who...
results.lead_paragraph: IN 1965 I wrote an article entitled "Will There Be Another Riot in Watts?" And I concluded, No, not as a spontaneous frustrated explosion resulting in indiscriminate slaughter. No, this will not happen again, for the truth of the matter is those who fought and those who died learned their lesson well.
